it.unipr.netsec.nemo.routing

Interface DynamicRouting

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OspfRouting, SdnRouting

    public interface DynamicRouting
    Generic routing mechanism, that is able to dynamically compute the routes toward all possible destinations. It can be either a centralized system (e.g. SDN controller) or a distributed routing protocol (like OSPF or RIP).

    Any node can contribute to the routing mechanism by providing local routing information (Link-State information) when connecting to the routing mechanism through the method connect(Address, LinkStateInfo[], DynamicRoutingInterface). It is up to the implemented routing mechanism how the provided routing information is used to compute all routes.

    Distance-Vector and Link-State routing protocols, as well as Software Defined Networking mechanisms, are possible implementations.

      • connect

        void connect(Address node_addr,
             LinkStateInfo[] lsa,
             DynamicRoutingInterface routing_interface)
        Connects a node to the routing mechanism.
        Parameters:
        node_addr - the node address
        lsa - array of link state info of the node
        routing_interface - the routing interface of the node

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(Address node_addr)

      • processReceivedPacket

        Packet processReceivedPacket(Address node_addr,
                             Packet pkt)
        When a node receives a new packet.
        Parameters:
        node_addr - the node address
        pkt - the received packet
        Returns:
        the original packet (if not processed by the routing mechanism) or null
